greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the closest number to n-th prime which is divisible by n.
formula: a(n)=n*floor[(floor(n/2)+p(n))/n], where p(n) is the n-th prime.
example: 24th prime, 89 is between 72 and 96, closer to 96, so a(24)=96;
25th prime, 97 is between 75 and 100, closer to 100, so a(25)=100.
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Apr 22 2003
